numbered_ace_sentences: 1. A person can observe a graph of college admissions.
2. The graph shows kids with a legacy boost.
3. The graph shows kids without a legacy boost.
4. Kids with a legacy boost have a more significant advantage than kids without a legacy boost.
5. The graph shows kids with the highest income level.
6. The graph shows kids with a higher income and a legacy boost.
7. Kids with the highest income level have an enormous disadvantage compared to kids with a higher income and a legacy boost.
11. I want to attend an Ivy League university.
12. I do not have a legacy.
13. Because I do not have a legacy, I am already behind before I apply.
14. This situation makes me more upset for students at an economic disadvantage.
15. Some students at an economic disadvantage are much better academically than another student with a legacy.
16. A school has a predisposed preference for a student with a legacy.
17. Because of this preference, the lesser student is more likely to be accepted.
